solution.text:
Area of the tent =4 \(\times \) area of the \(\bigtriangleup \) PQR
\(\bigtriangleup \) PQR we have PQ=PR=_{{5*j}}_ and QR=_{{6*j}}_ (given)
By using Heron's formula, area of PQR = \(\sqrt {s(s-a_1)(s-b_1)(s-c_1)}\) where \(a_1\),\(b_1\),\(c_1\) are the sides of the triangle and \(s=\frac {a_1+b_1+c_1}2 \)
Here \(PQ=a_1=_{{5*j}}_\),\(PR=b_1=_{{5*j}}_\) and \(QR=c_1=_{{6*j}}_\) so \(s=\frac {_{{5*j}}_+_{{5*j}}_+_{{6*j}}_}2=_{{8*j}}_\)
Therefore, area \(\bigtriangleup \) PQR= \(\sqrt {_{{8*j}}_(_{{8*j}}_-_{{5*j}}_)(_{{8*j}}_-_{{5*j}}_)(_{{8*j}}_-_{{6*j}}_)} = \sqrt {_{{8*j*(8*j-5*j)*(8*j-5*j)*(8*j-6*j)}}_}=_{{j*j*12}}_\)
Hence area of the tent = 4 \(\times \) area of the \(\bigtriangleup \) PQRc= 4\(\times \) _{{j*j*12}}_
\(\Rightarrow _{{j*j*48}}_\, m^2\)
Now total cost of the canvas = rate \(\times \) area of the tent
rate of Rs. _{k}_ per \(m^2\)
total cost of the canvas=\( _{k}_\times _{{j*j*48}}_\)
\(\Rightarrow Rs\,_{{k*j*j*48}}_ \)
